data.title: (VIDEO) Response to Bahamas PM by Dame Marguerite Pindling at PLP Rally â Clifford Park
data.text:
Remarks By Dame Marguerite Pindling Plp Rally â Clifford Park Nassau, Bahamas April 27th, 2012

I just had to come here tonight to set the record straight on a couple of things. Iâm told that last night, right here on Clifford Park, Hubert Ingraham suggested that he was Sir Lyndenâs rightful heir, not Perry Christie. I also understand that he played a piece from the video of Sir Lyndenâs farewell address to Parliament in which Sir Lynden referred to Mr. Ingraham as his âmost illustrious protÃ©gÃ© to dateâ.

Well, what I want to know, Mr. Ingraham â and I want you to look at me when Iâm talking to you, and put that cap on straight too â what I want to know, Mr. Ingraham, is this : if my late husband, the Father of our Nation, made you his heir, why did you then turn around and treat him so badly?

If he raised you up and made you his heir, why were you then so mean to him?

Werenât you the one who stood on this very park in 1992, after youâd won the election, and shouted out to the whole world âthe car goneâ¦the maid goneâ¦the cook goneâ! Wasnât it you? Is that how you repaid the man who you say made you his heir?

My husband and I had to hitch rides in 1992 after Ingraham came to power. When the new Parliament met, we got to the House of Assembly in a car that Dr. Frank Walkine had kindly loaned to us.

I will never forget â and I know Sir Lynden never forgot â how mean Mr. Ingraham was to us back then when we were at our lowest point. It was so cruel - and so unnecessary! Mr. Ingraham had already won, so why was it necessary to be so ungracious and so unkind? Sir Lynden was very deeply hurt by that. He really couldnât understand it. Neither could I.

You see, it was Sir Lynden who discovered Hubert Ingraham. It was Sir Lynden who made Hubert somebody. He raised Hubert up when nobody knew him. He went to bat for Hubert. He fought for him. It was Sir Lynden who had to twist a lot of arms at the PLP Convention to get Hubert elected as Chairman of the PLP. Then he got Hubert elected as an MP. And then he got him appointed to the Cabinet. But what was Sir Lyndenâs reward? Well, I think you know the answer to that.

But it didnât stop there.

You remember how they withheld Sir Lyndenâs pension? The Father of the Nation, the man who had led his country to Majority Rule, the man who had lifted up poor, barefoot black Bahamians like Hubert Ingraham, had to end up fighting for his pension so he could live in dignity. Can you imagine that? You young people out there have to learn about these things! Oâ and in case youâre wondering, Sir Lynden died flat broke. All those millions he was supposed to have, it was all propaganda, a complete myth.

And do you remember the Commission of Inquiry? I saw what that did to my husband. It caused him more stress than you can ever imagine. I know. I was his wife. I know what he went through. I was there. And Iâll tell you this too: I firmly believe that it was that stress that contributed to the illness that ended up taking Sir Lyndenâs life. I believe that with all my heart and soul. And I will believe it to my dying day. So, donât get me started!

But what I really came here tonight to tell you is that itâs completely untrue that Sir Lynden chose Ingraham to be his heir. Nothing could be further from the truth. The fact of the matter is that Sir Lynden put Hubert out of the PLP! He disowned him! He cast him off!

The man Lynden Pindling picked to be his heir was Perry Gladstone Christie, and no one else. He backed Perry to be the man to lead the PLP, and no one else. He never ever anointed Hubert to carry on his work. No, no, no! The man he picked for that was Perry Christie.

And Iâll tell you something else too : Perry was also Sir Cecil Wallace-Whitfieldâs choice to be the Leader of the FNM, not Hubert!

Now, that should tell you something about how good Perry must be, hey? If both Sir Lynden and Sir Cecil wanted him to take over as Leader of both the PLP and FNM, that should tell you what great leadership qualities Perry possesses.

Finally, in trying to be gracious to Mr. Ingraham in his farewell address to Parliament, Sir Lynden did indeed refer to Mr. Ingraham as his âmost illustrious protÃ©gÃ© to dateâ. But the key words there were âto dateâ. You see, when Sir Lynden spoke those words, Hubert had already been Prime Minister for five years. Perry at that time had not even become Leader of the PLP yet. So it was true that at that point in time when Sir Lynden spoke, Hubert, of all his Sir Lyndenâs protÃ©gÃ©s, had risen to more illustrious heights that any of his other protÃ©gÃ©s. Thatâs all Sir Lynden meant. He was certainly not indicating a preference for Hubert over Perry. Indeed, it was exactly the opposite because as Iâve already said Sir Lynden had cast Hubert off and put him out of the PLP. Thatâs how Hubert ended up in the FNM.

The record is clear : my husband was Perry Christieâs biggest backer. It was Pindling who made Perry his one and only heir to the mantle of leadership. Not Hubert nor anyone else.

So, Hubert Ingraham, donât let me have to come back out here to deal with you again! You might not like what I have to say next time.

PLPs, in closing : I want you to get behind your Leader, my Leader, Sir Lyndenâs chosen successor, his only rightful heir, the Right Honourable Perry Gladstone Christie. Perryâs the man! Letâs march with our Leader and on May 7th letâs all see that we vote PLP! I know thatâs what Sir Lynden would want us all to do!
